intro: Nonea dumanii, commonly known as the desert star or desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that produces yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. The plant has hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its roots are deep and extensive, allowing it to access groundwater. Nonea dumanii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in desert ecosystems.
